segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: For each EFI System Resource Table (ESRT) entry, you need a capsule for the latest firmware version.
segment.target: For each EFI System Resource Table (ESRT) entry, you need a capsule for the latest firmware version.

segment.source: The scenarios will refer to the latest version as X. Each ESRT entry is identified using a unique GUID.
segment.target: The scenarios will refer to the latest version as X. Each ESRT entry is identified using a unique GUID.

segment.source: For each ESRT entry exposed, create a capsule package that its version is incremented above the package created in step 1.
segment.target: For each ESRT entry exposed, create a capsule package that its version is incremented above the package created in step 1.

segment.source: These capsules will be referred to as X+1.
segment.target: These capsules will be referred to as X+1.

segment.source: Capsules that aid in simulating failure conditions such as a capsule for which the payload is not signed or signed with an invalid PK.
segment.target: Capsules that aid in simulating failure conditions such as a capsule for which the payload is not signed or signed with an invalid PK.

segment.source: Make sure all capsules to be used are signed appropriately from the OS perspective, catalog signed, and firmware signed, PK signed.
segment.target: Make sure all capsules to be used are signed appropriately from the OS perspective, catalog signed, and firmware signed, PK signed.

segment.source: How To
segment.target: How To

segment.source: Install a new capsule or reinstall a previously installed capsule
segment.target: Install a new capsule or reinstall a previously installed capsule

segment.source: Open up device manager.
segment.target: Open up device manager.

segment.source: Find the device node that represents your firmware, it is usually under the “Firmware” devices.
segment.target: Find the device node that represents your firmware, it is usually under the “Firmware” devices.

segment.source: Right click on the firmware device you wish to update.
segment.target: Right click on the firmware device you wish to update.

segment.source: Select Update driver software.
segment.target: Select Update driver software.

segment.source: You will get a popup that states “Update Driver Software - Firmware”.
segment.target: You will get a popup that states “Update Driver Software - Firmware”.

segment.source: Select Browse my computer for driver software.
segment.target: Select Browse my computer for driver software.

segment.source: On the next window, select Let me pick from a list of device drivers on my computer.
segment.target: On the next window, select Let me pick from a list of device drivers on my computer.

segment.source: If the driver has been installed before, select it from the Show compatible hardware box.
segment.target: If the driver has been installed before, select it from the Show compatible hardware box.

segment.source: If it does not exist, select Have disk and continue on.
segment.target: If it does not exist, select Have disk and continue on.

segment.source: Otherwise, select OK and reboot the system.
segment.target: Otherwise, select OK and reboot the system.

segment.source: If you select Have Disk, you will get a popup labeled Install From Disk.
segment.target: If you select Have Disk, you will get a popup labeled Install From Disk.

segment.source: Use Browse to go to the directory that has the capsule of the firmware you wish to install.
segment.target: Use Browse to go to the directory that has the capsule of the firmware you wish to install.

segment.source: Select the INF file in that directory and hit OK to install.
segment.target: Select the INF file in that directory and hit OK to install.

segment.source: During installation, if you get a popup saying the driver is not signed, go ahead and accept this driver.
segment.target: During installation, if you get a popup saying the driver is not signed, go ahead and accept this driver.

segment.source: The system asks you to reboot.
segment.target: The system asks you to reboot.

segment.source: After you installed the capsule for the firmware, you need to reboot.
segment.target: After you installed the capsule for the firmware, you need to reboot.

segment.source: If you wish to install multiple capsule packages, then wait to reboot until all capsules are installed and then reboot on the final capsule.
segment.target: If you wish to install multiple capsule packages, then wait to reboot until all capsules are installed and then reboot on the final capsule.

segment.source: Create a REGDWORD key with the name “Policy” under the node HKEYLOCALMACHINESYSTEMCurrentControlSetControlFirmwareResources{GUID} and set the value of the Policy key to 1.
